intro: Carduus laciniatus subsp. novorossicus, commonly known as the Novorossiysk thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Russia and parts of eastern Europe. It is characterized by its deeply lobed, silver-green leaves and tall, spiny stems that bear yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a robust root system that allows it to survive in arid conditions. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
